metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9465 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In task_get_unused_fd_flags of binder.c, there is a possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID: A-69164715 References: Upstream kernel.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9465` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
